frame.name: Wholes_and_parts
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Whole</fen> is made up of multiple <fen>Part</fen>s, which themselves may not be independent of each other or of the <fen>Whole</fen>. Wholes_and_parts is contrasted with Set_relation, where the Whole is simply a set of a number of (usually independent) parts.</def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> is the larger entity that includes the <fen>Part</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Part</fen> is either a subset or a constituent part of the <fen>Whole</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the inclusion event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the inclusion relation holds.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the inclusion relation holds.</def-root>
